Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Aquiluscidin (Aq-CATH; Lys-rich; natural AMPs; cathelicidins; Rattlesnake, reptiles, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: skin; oral mucosa, the Querétaro’s dark rattlesnake,Crotalus aquilus

Literature.Author: Hernández-Arvizu, E.E.; Silis-Moreno, T.M.; GarcíaArredondo, J.A.; Rodríguez-Torres, A.; Cervantes-Chávez, J.A.; Mosqueda, J. 2023
Literature.Title: Aquiluscidin, a Cathelicidin from Crotalus aquilus, and the Vcn-23 Derivative Peptide, Have Anti-Microbial Activity against Gram-Negative and Gram-Positive Bacteria

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (94.12%) torattlesnake Crotalicidin.   K: 38%; V: 12%, F: 18%. GRAVY: -0.48; M Wt: 4172.316; M formula:  C205H341N53O37S1, mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against E. coli TOP10 or clinical strain (MIC 0.47 uM), S. aureus ATCC6538 or clinical strain (MIC 1.91 uM), P. aeruginosa or clinical strain (MIC 0.95 uM), S. saprophyticus ATCC BAA-750 (MIC 0.95 uM), S. typhymurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 1.91 uM), and  E. casseliflavus ATCC 700327 (MIC 0.95 uM).parasites: Aquiluscidin inhibited B. ovata (IC50 14.48 uM) and B. bovis (IC50 20.7 uM). Activity is serum-sensitive:parasites  (Hernández-Arvizu et al., 2024).Toxicity: rat RBC: less than 3% hemolysis at 50 uM (incubated 30 min). HEK293 cells (IC50 ~35 uM).Structure:  predicted to be amphipathic helix.Updated 6/2024
